DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Anatomic Site Uberon Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Uberon identifier for the location within the body targeted by a therapeutic agent that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

Property.changeDescription: Updated to point to NCI Thesaurus concept code.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 1/17/24 txfr ownership to CRDC for Uberon updates in associated CDE; existing PCDC CDE 13361747 associated with new DEC to better align with latest PCDC DD. jk;   4/24/2023: update the short name to match OC public ID and added Origin to DEC.wz

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols and characters to capture the UBERON anatomic site code (ex: UBERON:0006209 or UBERON_0006209)._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: An integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function, and developmental lineage. The ontology includes comprehensive relationships to taxon-specific anatomical ontologies, allowing integration of functional, phenotype and expression data.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 1/17/24 per DSS call today updated DN CDE to use Uberon VD, DEC to include anatomic site and revised definition to reflect use of Uberon id as representation. jk;  9/5/23 Created per CRDC DSS. mr
